publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-283# Mrs Margaret Smith: Social Workers and Violence—That the Parliament deplores the escalating levels of violence visited upon social workers in Edinburgh in the course of their duties; recognises that this is a national problem, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to promote the view that having to face the threat of violence is not an acceptable feature of any profession.
S1M-283# Social Workers and Violence (lodged on 15 November 1999) Scott Barrie*
S1M-283# Social Workers and Violence (lodged on 15 November 1999) Irene McGugan*

S1M-283# Mrs Margaret Smith: Social Workers and Violence—That the Parliament deplores the escalating levels of violence visited upon social workers in Edinburgh in the course of their duties; recognises that this is a national problem, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to promote the view that having to face the threat of violence is not an acceptable feature of any profession. Supported by: Scott Barrie, Irene McGugan
S1M-283# Social Workers and Violence (lodged on 15 November 1999) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-283# Social Workers and Violence (lodged on 15 November 1999) Trish Godman*
S1M-283# Social Workers and Violence (lodged on 15 November 1999) Margaret Jamieson*, Cathy Jamieson*

S1M-283# Mrs Margaret Smith: Social Workers and Violence—That the Parliament deplores the escalating levels of violence visited upon social workers in Edinburgh in the course of their duties; recognises that this is a national problem, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to promote the view that having to face the threat of violence is not an acceptable feature of any profession. Supported by: Scott Barrie, Irene McGugan, Tommy Sheridan, Trish Godman, Margaret Jamieson, Cathy Jamieson, Fiona Hyslop*
S1M-283# Social Workers and Violence (lodged on 15 November 1999) Nora Radcliffe*, Kay Ullrich*, Michael Matheson*
S1M-283# Social Workers and Violence (lodged on 15 November 1999) Donald Gorrie*, Fergus Ewing*

S1M-283# Mrs Margaret Smith: Social Workers and Violence—That the Parliament deplores the escalating levels of violence visited upon social workers in Edinburgh in the course of their duties; recognises that this is a national problem, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to promote the view that having to face the threat of violence is not an acceptable feature of any profession. Supported by: Scott Barrie, Irene McGugan, Tommy Sheridan, Trish Godman, Margaret Jamieson, Cathy Jamieson, Fiona Hyslop, Nora Radcliffe, Kay Ullrich, Michael Matheson, Donald Gorrie, Fergus Ewing

S1M-283# Mrs Margaret Smith: Social Workers and Violence—That the Parliament deplores the escalating levels of violence visited upon social workers in Edinburgh in the course of their duties; recognises that this is a national problem, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to promote the view that having to face the threat of violence is not an acceptable feature of any profession. Supported by: Scott Barrie, Irene McGugan, Tommy Sheridan, Trish Godman, Margaret Jamieson, Cathy Jamieson, Fiona Hyslop, Nora Radcliffe, Kay Ullrich, Michael Matheson, Donald Gorrie, Fergus Ewing, Kate Maclean*

S1M-283# Mrs Margaret Smith: Social Workers and Violence—That the Parliament deplores the escalating levels of violence visited upon social workers in Edinburgh in the course of their duties; recognises that this is a national problem, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to promote the view that having to face the threat of violence is not an acceptable feature of any profession. Supported by: Scott Barrie, Irene McGugan, Tommy Sheridan, Trish Godman, Margaret Jamieson, Cathy Jamieson, Fiona Hyslop, Nora Radcliffe, Kay Ullrich, Michael Matheson, Donald Gorrie, Fergus Ewing, Kate Maclean
S1M-283# Social Workers and Violence (lodged on 15 November 1999) Ms Margo MacDonald*

S1M-283# Mrs Margaret Smith: Social Workers and Violence—That the Parliament deplores the escalating levels of violence visited upon social workers in Edinburgh in the course of their duties; recognises that this is a national problem, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to promote the view that having to face the threat of violence is not an acceptable feature of any profession. Supported by: Scott Barrie, Irene McGugan, Tommy Sheridan, Trish Godman, Margaret Jamieson, Cathy Jamieson, Fiona Hyslop, Nora Radcliffe, Kay Ullrich, Michael Matheson, Donald Gorrie, Fergus Ewing, Kate Maclean, Ms Margo MacDonald
S1M-283# Social Workers and Violence (lodged on 15 November 1999) Robin Harper*
S1M-283# Social Workers and Violence (lodged on 15 November 1999) Maureen Macmillan*
S1M-283# Social Workers and Violence (lodged on 15 November 1999) Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Michael Russell*
